Per Game |- ! scope="row" | | 371,884 || 23 || 16,169 |- ! scope="row" | | 334,545 || 25 || 13,382 |- ! scope="row" | | 299,766 || 25 ||11,991 |- ! scope="row" | | 261,893 || 24 ||10,912 |- ! scope="row" | | 215,638 || 23 ||9,376 |- ! scope="row" | | 188,871 || 22 ||8,585 |- ! scope="row" | | 150,038 || 22 ||6,820 |- ! scope="row" | | 142,541 || 22 ||6,479 |- ! scope="row" | | 118,051 || 22 ||5,366 |- ! scope="row" | | 100,839 || 22 ||4,584 |} ==Awards and events== ===Awards=== Mark of the Year - Michael Farquhar ===Events=== * On 3 May (Round 5), Port Adelaide player Tim Evans kicks a club record 16 goals, as the Magpies defeat West Adelaide 28.19 (187) to 10.10 (70). ===Premiers=== ==Notes== ==References== Category:South Australian National Football League seasons SANFL
